explanation: The report is correct. In OS_CountSemGetInfo the local variable record is only used to read fields (record->name_entry and record->creator) and is never used to modify the pointed-to object. MISRA C 2023 Rule 8.13 advises that a pointer should point to a const-qualified type whenever possible; therefore record should be declared as const OS_common_record_t *record. The macro OS_OBJECT_TABLE_GET yields an OS_common_record_t * and implicit conversion to const OS_common_record_t * is allowed, so changing the declaration to const is safe and satisfies the rule. (If the code later needed to perform writes via that pointer, const would not be appropriate, but that is not the case here.)
